activitySummary: The user is actively engaged in writing and navigating code within the Visual Studio Code IDE. The code being worked on is related to a class named 'CountStepsNotCompletedService' which includes methods for counting and assigning steps related to an 'Opportunity' application. The user is also running tests for this class, as indicated by the test results visible in the IDE.

The user is also working within the Salesforce platform, specifically in the 'Fields & Relationships' section of the 'Opportunity' object. This involves viewing and possibly editing various fields related to the 'Opportunity' object, such as 'Hired Date/Time', 'HR Onboarding Specialist', and 'Last Active Stage'. This activity suggests the user is managing or configuring data structures within Salesforce.

The user is seen switching between Visual Studio Code and Google Chrome, indicating a workflow that involves both coding and managing Salesforce configurations. The user is likely integrating or synchronizing data between a custom application and Salesforce, as evidenced by the simultaneous use of these tools.
aiUseSummary: There is no visible evidence of AI tools being used in the provided screenshots. The user is primarily engaged in coding and managing Salesforce configurations without any interaction with AI chat interfaces or AI-driven tools.
